story.name: CRUD for Business Partners and Campaigns

story.description: Extract the software versions check task from the returns flow, this includes views, migrations, controllers and models. Update it to the new task interface by removing the task module
story.name: Extract software version from returns flow

story.description: Extract the function test task from the returns flow, this includes views, migrations, controllers and models. Update it to the new task interface by removing the task module
story.name: Extract Function test from returns flow

story.description: Extract the function test task from the returns flow, this includes views, migrations, controllers and models. Update it to the new task interface by removing the task module
story.name: Extract Cosmetic test from returns flow

story.description: Add a task to simply prompt the user to select the correct language for the device. Check the wording with Alex or Craig
story.name: Add task to prompt user to set the language of the device

task.description: Create a prompt class
Subclass from and store prompt types
check integration

story.description: Create a lanugage check task which is a yes no question on if the language on the phone is set correctly. Get the wording of the question from Alex or Craig
story.name: Create language check task

story.description: Create a task to record the condition of the device. The options are: New Sample Graded
story.name: Create Device Condition Task

story.description: We currently don't have any details on the interface for Navision other than it will be a call to a web service. However to continue the development of the flow we need some information. For this task we want to create a stub resource inorder that we can start development on the main flow
story.name: Stub Device Details Task

story.description: Extract confrim software version from the returns flow including views, migrations, models and tests.
story.name: Extract confirm sortware version from returns flow

task.description: Extract the model, controller, views and migrations into the workflow gem.
Integrate the confirm software versions into the flow.

story.description: Extract the Software version task from the returns flow including migrations, views, controllers and model. Update the model to the new interface by removing the task module Extract the software versions resource to a new class using rest-client over active resource
story.name: Extract Software versions checks from O2 DHL returns flow

story.description: Create the flow for inspection screening
story.name: Create screening flow for inspection
Map CPP products to Navision Products

task.description: CreateUI flow to manage multiple matrices
Create UI flow to manage alternatives for a specific matrix
It would be nice to be able to search product library from these screens.

story.description: Dynamics Nav exposes an API which returns all the device info for a given serial. This needs to be called when an operator scans an IMEI in order to determine what they have.
story.name: Integrate inspection flow with Dynamics Nav to get device information

story.description: After a device has been screened by an operator it needs to be moved to the correct warehouse location depending on whether it passed or failed. Dynamics Nav exposes an API which can be used to do this
story.name: Integrate inspection flow with Dynamics Nav in order to update a device location.

story.description: As a fulfillment operator I want to pick and pack devices So that I can get the ready for dispatch to the customer
story.name: Fulfill Replacement Orders

task.description: Setup initial Fulfillment line
Create capture claim reference page to start fulfillment flow
Create scan imei task to capture replacement imei
Create task to check if correct device has been picked
Add routing instruction to send to dispatch

story.description: See Courier collections task for attachments which outline the letters required.
story.name: Dispatch Replacement Orders

story.description:
Not all devices should offer alternatives, therefore each alternative matrix should be assigned to a single campaign.
Alternative Matrices also need to consider which model variants can be used. It should be possible to restrict the availability of variants in the matrix.
story.name: Campaigns for alternative matrices

task.description: Create a resource on ActiveAdmin to maintain campaigns
Link the alternative matrix model to the campaign model
Add allowable variants to the alternative matrix

story.description:
Given that a list of alternative items has been retrieved from the alternative matrix,
Retrieve the current stock levels of those items from Dynamics Nav And choose which item to fulfill the claim
story.name: Make Dynamics Nav call to get Stock levels for alternative products.

task.description: Call Dynamics Nav to get stock levels
Select the best replacement which has a current positive stock level

story.description: A find route is required for cpp_claims, the URI would be /cpp_claims/find/[CLAIM_REF].json
story.name: Create finder for claim reference

note.text: Bumped this a 3 as it is slightly more difficult than anticipated - ML
note.author: Developers

story.description:
Manual update of CPP Courier collections.
Display list of courier collections. Each courier collection can be updated with the consignment number
story.name: Courier Collections

story.description:
Operator should be able to search for a claim. Should cover all claims - in progress as well as historical.
Search terms? Confirm with Duncan
story.name: search for claims

story.description:
CPP should use a standalone product library, not share the current Normanton one.
It can initially be populated with a copy of the existing db, but it is expected to diverge.
story.name: separate product library for CPP products

task.description: Deploy a 2nd product library for CPP use.
update deployment scripts to use correct product library

story.description: At dispatch advise which box should be used to send the device in.
story.name: advise which box to to use

task.description: Add box details to campaigns
Use campaign to advise operator whihc box to use

story.description:
Given that an automatic mapping from the CPP product has failed,
Provide user a list of of failures, For each present a screen which allows the correct Product Library product to be selected and record the mapping
story.name: Manual intervention to map CPP product to Product library

task.description: Extract existing claim product asset into workflow gem
Add manual workaround into claim product asset
Adjust flow in replacement order to accommodate manual workaround for claim product asset

story.description:
Given that no direct alternative replacement devices are in stock,
Present a list of all claims which can not automatically be allocated from which an operator can select a specific claim.
Given that the operator has selected a claim present operator with details of the claim (Name, address, phone, device, etc)
Given that the operator has selected a claim, present the operator with list of indirect replacement devices and stock levels.
Given that the customer has chosen a replacement device, allow the choice to be recorded.
story.name: Operator ability to choose alternative handset

task.description: Present list of all claims which cannot automatically be fulfilled
Present details of individual claim
Make call to Navision to get stock levels of indirect replacements
Present list of alternative replacement devices and stock levels
Record replacement device selected

story.description: It has been determined that after functional testing a detrash and labelling task is required.
story.name: detrash and label subjob

task.description: Scan in device
ensure device is in inspection_pass BIN
Present detrash screen and link to print label
print label
Move device to pack BIN

story.description: If a product has been added with the same make, model, etc but the characteristic is different the system will complain that it is a duplicate - see attached screenshot
story.name: Product library should allow 2 devices differentiated only by characteristic

note.text: Product Characteristics Categories are failing when they need to be updated.
note.author: Developers

task.description: Allow product characteristics categories to be updated
Fix the build script to use CPP logs files for the CPP tenant

story.description:
When an operator is on a call with a customer (e.g. choosing non-direct replacement) provide opportunity to record free text.
Note should also record time/date and operator.
story.name: Record notes about customer interaction

story.description:
[PLACEHOLDER - More requirements needed]
When a broken device is returned by the claimant it is necessary to screen the device to validate IMEI, model, etc
story.name: Returned device validation claim flow

story.description: Given a device booked in as accidental damage When at the screening station Then it is processed via catastrophic damage Then it is processed via cosmetic tests Then it is processed via functional tests
story.name: Accidental Damage Screening flow

task.description: Check MARS screen insurance job to see what can be used/applicable
Add tasks to the workflow tasks gem as required

story.description:
Given a returned accidental damage claim When At book in And the box is empty Then the job should be recorded as empty box And moved to a quarantine state
An operator can display a list of all devices in the quarantine state.
An operator can select a device in the quarantine state and can choose whether to accept or reject the claim.
If the claim is accepted we will continue with the claim. Otherwise inform the operator.
story.name: Accidental Damage Book in empty box received

task.description: Define quarantine station for book in accidental damage
Route accidental damage to quarantine when box empty
Define finder page for accidental damage claims in quarantine station
Define task on quarantine station to accept or reject claim
Define event publishing on cpp_returns
Add hydra processors to update accidental damage claims on cpp_claims following quarantine

story.description: Alternative matrices only allow variants to be specified at the matrix level. We want to be able to specify different variants depending on the device e.g. iPhones allow different variants than non-iPhones.
story.name: Allow variants to be specified at the model level

story.description:
Alex attempted to change the bottom (last) question to the be the top (first) and got a busy cursor.
An exception has also been generated
story.name: Cannot sort questions in Test Library

note.text: Other Apps: New exception TestQuestionsController#reorder (ActiveRecord::StatementInvalid) "Mysql2::Err... http://getexl.com/6fcdm Message TestQuestionsController#reorder (ActiveRecord::StatementInvalid) "Mysql2::Error: Duplicate entry '129' for key 1: INSERT INTO `test_question_categories` (`id`,`position`,`category_id`,`test_question_id`,`created_by`,`updated_by`,`cr... Time 13 Nov at 03:51PM URL post http://cpp-test-library.therepairline.co.uk/function_tests/reorder/mobile_phone Backtrace /data/test_library/releases/20111108133739/app/controllers/test_questions_controller.rb:116:in `block in reorder' /data/test_library/releases/20111108133739/app/controllers/test_questions_controller.rb:115:in `reorder' /data/test_library/releases/20111108133739/vendor/plugins/users_plugin/lib/users_controller.rb:62:in `handle_user_for_json_requests'
note.author: Developers

story.description:
Given that an indirect replacement device has been selected which was not in stock,
Provide an automatic process which will periodically check for stock of the replacement device and when found push the claim to fulfillment
story.name: Back orders

story.description: Queries to get matching device type is failing. E.g search for a bb 5800 and get a 5100 returned
story.name: Product library returning incorrect answers to queries

story.description:
There are two claim types currently in the system LossTheftClaim and AccidentalDamageClaim .
We need a 3rd which is very similar to AccidentalDamageClaim but the replacement handset is sent immediately, with the damaged device recovery started simultaneously.
story.name: ReplaceAndRecoverClaim

story.description: Remove the DHL and Normanton branding from cpp-claims and cpp-insurance
story.name: Branding of CPP applications

task.description: Change 'DHL Normanton' tab to a home tag

story.description:
To review what has been fulfilled it is requested to have a report which shows the - Claim Authorization number - Original claim device - Replacement claim device - claim status
for all claim replacements which are ready for shipping or have been shipped.
Report should be filterable by day
story.name: View all fulfilled jobs

story.description: Label is left on device when dispatched to customer. They should not see what variant of stock was used to fulfil their claim
story.name: Device label should not include variant

story.description: Once a claim has been succesfully filled we need to let Navision know two things 1) A handset has been used and should be removed from stock 2) A job must be created which represents the costs and charges for fulfilling that claim.
story.name: On successful dispatch of a claim replacement device update Navision stock level and create job

story.description: When creating a claim only stock in the warehouse zone should be offered for fulfilment of that claim
story.name: Should only use stock from the warehouse to fulfil claims

note.text: Requires zone be added to web service/code unit to allow us to filter by zone
note.author: Developers

story.description: Delivery type is set at a campaign level, but iPhones always use special delivery irrespective of the campaign
story.name: iPhone deliveries should always be special delivery

story.description: On the shipment screen the letter is not populated ready for printing
story.name: No shipment letters

story.description:
A screen should be displayed which allows an operator to view all the jobs currently waiting fulfilment.
Clicking on a Job will change state from fulfilment to be being_fulfilled and remove it from the list. The Operator's page should move to the current fulfilment screen, telling them which location to pick a device from.
Further, from the device selection screen it must be possible to return the job to fulfilment in case it cannot be completed.
story.name: Provide a list of all claims waiting fulfillment

story.description:
When a device is OFR (initially just BB and apple) it should be recorded in Dynamics Nav .
This is a 2 stage process.
First the device needs to be added to DN by the positiveAdjustment API.
Secondly the CreateReturnOrder records the device has been shipped off system and records the details of the expected return (non-damaged Item #)
story.name: Record OFR devices in Navision

story.description:
If the product library contains a network specific model, but we don't care about network for a particular claim the matching will not work.
The Product lib call will return the network specific model (eg iPhone 4 16GB EE) because we only have the SIM free version (iPhone 4 16GB) configured in the alternative matrix.
story.name: Alternative device not found if network model is missing from alternative list

story.description: Given that an AD claim has been received Then a Jiffy bag needs to be dispatched with the correct letter and labelling depending on the claim scheme.
story.name: Jiffy bag letter and label

story.description: On the Create New Shipment screen in claims it is necessary to display the customer's name and address to the operator so they can copy them into the booking system.
story.name: Display Customer address details on the fulfillment page

story.description:
Two different letter heads are used for the CPP letters.
Which paper to use is specified in the Outbound Letter Paper column of LetterMatrix.xsls (see Courier Collections story).
For launch it is decided to use two printers, one loaded with each paper type.
When the letter is displayed with a link to print we need to show a message saying which printer to use (Tristan is setting up queues and can confirm printer names)
story.name: Use correct headed paper for letters

story.description: Given A device has been booked in as accidental damage When the book in is complete Then it will proceed to a screening station
story.name: Create a screening flow for Accidental Damage

story.description:
Given a device has been booked in as accidental damage And the device is a returned DOA When at Screening Then it should be processed via cosmetic and functional tests
(DOA limit 14 days)
story.name: Accidental Damage DOA/Warranty screening process

note.text: Device screening branched by claim type on cpp claims.
note.author: Developers

note.text: Check doa imei matches imei on linked CPP2 claim in cpp claims
note.author: Developers

task.description: Find out how we can tell a device is DOA (claim data?)
Incorporate claim type (on claim model) into claim details on returns side
Separate book in branch for DOAs to ensure that the device we have received matches the one we expect
Add routing instruction accepted doa in book in and add transition to doa screening station on line
New screening station for DOAs
Incorporate cosmetic tests and function tests into DOA screening flow. Pass : Back in Stock, Fail : Salvage

story.description: cpp address labels are smaller than expected. Need to reformat the address to fit.
story.name: Wrong label size

story.description: Validation on claim reference number field still set to 6 characters. Will not process new 7 digit ref numbers. Although failures now show in the exception queue
story.name: Claim reference number validation

story.description:
When a claim falls into no direct replacement it caches the alternative matrix in force at that time.
We want the ability to change the alt matrix and when an operator looks at the claim in unprocessed orders they will see the alternatives in force at the time they view it.
story.name: Replacement orders do not re-evaluate alternatives

story.description: Task to initiate replacement order on an AD claim when we have validated the returned device
story.name: Receipt of AD device

story.description: Devices which can be repaired by Glasgow express should be routed straight there.
story.name: Accidental Damage - Repair

task.description: Create dispatch job
Check device type for AD claims, (call viability application)
Print CPP1 label for devices which can be repaired
Generate VN1 pre-alert for devices which can be repaired (Hydra)

story.description:
When choosing an indirect alternative, the window shows the Make, Model, Item Number headers, but only the Variant is shown in the Make column. All other columns are blank.
Need to see Make & Model descriptions as well as the item and variant when choosing an indirect alternative
story.name: No model descriptions shown for indirect alternatives

story.description:
http://cpp-insurance-uat.therepairline.co.uk/cpp_claims/12/replacement_order/shipment/new
The address details shown at the top of the page are missing Town, County & Postcode.
story.name: Address details missing from Create Shipment flow

story.description:
http://cpp-insurance-uat.therepairline.co.uk/cpp_claims/20/replacement_order/claim_asset_product/new
Unable to select correct OEM from Product Library for Auth 12586970. Status is claim_asset_product, but when you select "I don't have a product code" and choose Sony Ericsson it hangs and will not display any models.
I can choose other OEMs and it will show me their models, but not Sony Ericsson. This happens across all claims, not just this one.
story.name: Product Library

story.description: Calls to Test Lib from CPP returns have a hard coded item code. This should be a param.
story.name: Implement stub Test Library call

task.description: Get item number for call to test library
Make call to test library based on item number parameter

story.description:
http://cpp-returns-uat.therepairline.co.uk/inspection_lines/1322678859468811/flash_station/current_software_versions/new
Got the 'something went wrong' box when I scanned the device into the flash workflow (IMEI 356810031043740)
story.name: Flash workflow bombs

story.description: When the result of the claim fulfilment is that the customer is to be sent a different model than that they claim for then the packer must be informed to ship a "full kit" instead of just handset only.
story.name: Alternative devices need to be full kit

story.description: Currently we start a replacement shipment by supplying the claim number, but this won't be known to the person doing the task. Change the page to take an IMEI so they can scan the device in front of them when preparing a shipment
story.name: Initiate shipment based on scanning IMEI

story.description: The job number should be a unique identifier. Claim ref may be used more than once.
story.name: Job numbers are the same as claim refs

story.description: ... shows claim ref instead of claim auth
story.name: Jiffy Bag Queue...

story.description: Because there is no software library the process gets stuck at "cannot find software version please contact your supervisor".
story.name: Cannot process device through flash

story.description: Importing a claim file (like attached) is not parsing long numbers (like IMEI and External Policy # correctly)
story.name: Incorrect parsing of claim CSV file

story.description: As a user I need to see whether the claim is an accidental damage or loss/theft claim when packing the device so I know whether to include a replacement memory card.
story.name: Claim type on shipment screen

story.description: The consignment number of the outgoing royal mail special delivery bag needs to be captured (scanned) when dispatching jiffy bags for device retrieval.
story.name: Consignment number not captured when processing jiffy bags

story.description: The Print Labels button needs to print both the customer address label and the correct CPP1-5 label
story.name: Label printing at jiffy bag despatch

story.description:
New requirement to reserve a device when the replacement algorithm decides which model to use. TSG will implement a new API which does the actual reservation and returns the serial of the reserved device.
On device pick we now need to indicate the device serial to be picked and display the bin in which that device is located.
story.name: Device Reservation

story.description: To verify the live environment we want to deploy with the DNav webservices pointing at the UAT Test company.
story.name: Create live environement

task.description: Build a live environment on engineyard
Sort rabbitMQ versions

copy database tables from UAT - alternative_matrices, box_types, business_partners, campaigns, claim_creation_rules, insurance_schemas, product_alternative_lists, product_alternatives, product_variant_alternatives, variant_alternatives
Verify Live URLs and config
Test and verify correct functioning

story.description:
As a phone agent I require the ability to search for a customer's claim and view all details about that claim. Including - Handset claimed for - Replacement handset details (if allocated) - Any notes recorded about that claim along with agent and timestamp.
I also require the ability to add new notes to the claim.
I also require the ability to change the delivery address.
story.name: Enhance claim summary screen

story.description: AD Bookin flow asks for a claim reference to start. This should be either the Claim Authorisation Number or the incoming consignment reference (need both fields, but flow will start with either one)
story.name: AD Bookin flow

task.description: Add claim authorisation number and consignment reference to the accidental damage line.
On start of a new AD line, find either the existing line model with the claim authorisation number or the consignment reference.
If neither exists, create a new claim with the appropriate number.
When validating the input, all claim authorisation numbers are 8 digits long, anything else is a consignment reference.

story.description: As a call center operator I require the ability to raise a CPP3 or 5 replacement. Which is raised depends on whether the claim was fulfilled more than 14 days ago.
story.name: CPP3/5

story.description: Given that I have received a device which is not a Blackberry or Apple I want to screen it and move it to a damaged stock location
story.name: Receive non apple/BB damaged devices

story.description: As an admin user I require the ability to cancel a claim which has not been fulfilled.
story.name: Claim cancellation

story.description:
IMEI: 012761005016640 i-Phone 3G S
This device was booked in but when the operator tried to process the device VNet crashed as sson as the IMEI was scanned at inspection.
story.name: Priority Bug: CPP2 device cannot process through inspection
Priority Bug: Unable to process CPP3 device through inspection

note.text: Tested in UAT function test fail on Screening station example: 196316126616394 function test fail - reject. working ok
note.author: Tester

story.description: Allow a claim to be raised with the same authorisation number as a cancelled claim
story.name: Re-raise a cancelled claim
Detrash label print only displaying Product Familty need colour and memory variants.

story.description: There are cases where the selected direct or indirect replacement device cannot be sourced and an admin level user should be able to select an ITEM and VARIANT without any restrictions as to whether setup as an alternative.
story.name: Admin override of replacement phone

task.description: Add input fields for Item No. and variant to for form in new no direct replacement asset product
Add functionality to lookup and assign item from new input fields

story.description: For Recorded delivery campaigns, iPhones are showing this as the dispatch method. iPhones should /always/ be Special Delivery
story.name: iPhone shipment screen showing recorded delivery

story.description:
Finance (Sharon) require a backup file to be generated on a date range which list all fulfilled claims.
Please find attached a copy of the supporting documentation we provide to CPP on a weekly basis for each of the schemes. The “jacinta upload” file contains the data for the £155 fixed price scheme as well as TMobile Iphones and RBS. Ideally I would like to run one report per scheme which would act as the supporting back-up to the invoice. I’ve attached all the detail that is supplied in a typical week for starters.
story.name: Generate "support" files for claim submissions

story.description: The tab delimited file created as a pre-alert for VN1 repairs has a UTF8 encoding. This is not importing correctly as it needs to be ANSI. Mark Lamont can supply "good" and "bad" files if required.
story.name: VisionNet 1 repair pre-alert file has wrong encoding

story.description: When viewing the list of replacement orders any cancelled claims should be filtered out
story.name: Hide cancelled orders from the replacement_orders list

story.description: As an administrator who has just modified the alternative matrix I want the ability to force a re-evaluation of all unpicked orders in order to apply the change I have just made.
story.name: Force alternative re-evaluation

story.description: When a product is in claim_asset_product and the operator chooses to process/fix it there is an option to enter the Product code or find the product via drop downs. Choosing to enter a code does not work and generates an error
story.name: Indentify Product: Enter product code doesn't work

story.description: Need the claim model to be visible in the 'replacement orders' queue so we can allocate phones/product codes to customer claims. This is having a huge impact on a high volume of daily orders coming through. We keep going back into the same claims that we are unable to fulfil - need clear visibility
story.name: Claimed model visible on queues

story.description: As a cs operator I want the ability to raise a 14-day claim on an existing 14-day claim.
story.name: Cannot raise a 14-day claim on a 14-day claim

story.description:
Devices that fail inspection in VNet are not being routed to the correct location in DNav. Operator is being told to route device to "reject" and there is no background movement completed in DNav.
When a device is failed at inspection the following should happen:
1. VNet makes a call to DNav to find the vendor information 2. VNet should display the DNav RTV location (based on the vendor) to the inspection operator. 3. VNet should then instruct DNav to create a movement from "Aw inspection" to "RTVxxxxxx"
story.name: Inspection Fail Routing

note.text: Devices Tested: Devices for Inspection: Apple iPhone 3G S 32 GB Black APLIP3S3BKSFIXX 215003773676726 -> inspection failed bin RTV 202001. BLACKBERRY 8900 RIM8900XNASFIXX 891215643561661 -> inspection failed bin RTV 202001
note.author: Tester

task.description: Display the rtv location on the routing page on reject

story.description: Before attempting to look up a claim asset product in the Product library we should default to black if no colour has been specified in the claim file
story.name: Use colour black for iphone when not specified

story.description: cpp needs to be setup on cpp with email notifications configured
story.name: eMail alerts

story.description: As a user I want to be able to see the date and time that a shipment was created while on the claim summary screen
story.name: Display shipment date and time on claim summary

story.description: If a 14-day return is processed through QA and is found to have no faults it should be moved to awaiting put-away
story.name: Good 14-day stock should be returned to warehouse

story.description: As a user I want to be able to change the claim asset product when raising a 14-day claim since it is possible that the wrong device was sent on the original order.
story.name: Choose alternative device for 14-day return

task.description: Allow user to alter product details from original claim and record it against the new claim
Allow user to alter the network from the original claim and record it against the new claim

story.description: As an operator I want to see the network and grade of stock on the /replacement_orders list along side the model and manufacturer.
story.name: Display network and grade on replacement orders

story.description:
When trying to add the new Acer C6 Product VNet advises that product already exists.
I think that the issue is related to the fact there is already a Nokia C6 product within the PL and this is identified using the C6 Cpp Model Characteristic. I cannot create another C6 CPP Model Characteristic as this already esists.
Could this be resolved?
story.name: Product Library Issue: Cannot create Acer C6 Product

story.description: As a QA operator I want to see an indication that an error occurred when creating a Nav movement e.g. moving from awaiting_inspection to awaiting_pack. the system should not prevent me from processing the next handset, this is just a warning that something has failed.
story.name: Display Navision Movement error to QA operator

note.text: There is no simple way of reporting something from an after transition on the line so that it can be viewed on screen by the operator.
note.author: Developers

story.description: As an agent I want to be able to see the variant of the replacement device in the claim summary screen.
story.name: Add replacement device variant to claim summary screen

story.description: As a user I want to be able to choose whether a full kit or device only should be dispatched when I am choosing an alternative device. If I do not select anything device only should be assumed.
story.name: full kit changes

story.description: As an agent I want to see the claim authorisation number when I look on screen at which claims are included in a pre-alert file.
story.name: Show claim authorisation in Repair pre-alert screens

story.description: The number of BER and repair outcomes is too large for one page. Added pagination and sorted to show last entry first.
story.name: Paginate ber and repair outcomes

story.description: Cost and price data needs to be added to Pentaho as a measure so that it can be reported on
story.name: Add cost and price data to pentaho

story.description: Repair outcomes is searching on claim number, not claim authorisation number.
story.name: Repair outcomes should search on claim authorisation

story.description: As a finance user I want to see that the costs when a device is used on a claim match the costs when it was purchased.
story.name: Use correct costs in Navision

story.description: Currently we generate a credit as soon as a 14-day claim is raised. We shouldn't be doing this until the customer has actually sent back a handset and it has been screened as good (or bad) stock.
story.name: CPP refunds shouldn't be generated until 14 day device is returned

task.description: Remove claim generation from create claim process.
Create an ActiveResource end point in CPP Claims to handle claim credit creation from CPP Returns
Call claim credit endpoint when the screening for a DOA device is good or bad stock.

story.description: As a customer centre operator I should be prevented from cancelling claims when they have already shipped. When a claim is cancelled, any device reserved for that claim should be released to be available on another claim. Any attempts to pick or ship a cancelled claim should result in the operator being told to return the handset to the correct stock location.
story.name: Device Cancellation process

task.description: Prevent completed or cancelled claims from being cancelled
Remove any existing device reservation when cancelling a claim
Display message to operator including warehouse location when attempt to pick or ship a cancelled claim

story.description: When a BER report is received from Glasgow express I want to know that the actual device is received back. As well as releasing a replacement device the system should record that we are expecting the BER handset to be returned. As an insurance operator I want a screen where I can scan the IMEI of all received BER handsets and be told if it was expected to be received, If we were expecting it the device should be added to the BER location on Dynamics Nav with a zero cost and under a damaged item #.
story.name: Receive BER devices from Glasgow express

story.description: There is a change to use DPD for most shipments - their consignment numbers do not match the 13 character length validation which is currently enforced. Change to allow any length of consignment between 1 and 14.
story.name: Support DPD Consignment numbers

story.description: Currently 14-day devices which pass screening are moved into a bin called 14 DAY GOOD STOCK. Requirement to put them in AWAITING PUTAWAY instead so that they can quickly be processed and added to the warehouse stock.
story.name: Change 14-day good stock location

story.description: As a finance user I want to know that screened 14-day return good stock is put into the system with the price it was originally purchased with.
story.name: 14-day Good stock should have the same cost value as when it was purchased

story.description: A new process is required to screen devices which are returned because delivery could not be completed - see attached.
story.name: Failed delivery screening process

task.description: Scan consignment number and capture reason
Sealed bag check
Device IMEI and make/model checks
Add to Dynamics Nav location
Raise credit
Add to claims app failed delivery queue

story.description: When a failed delivery has been screened the claim will be added to a failed delivery queue. Operator requires to be able to select a job and decide whether to raise a replacement or cancel the claim. If raising a new order an option to change the address details is presented (original claim details must be retained)
story.name: Failed delivery resolution queue

task.description: Create a resource for failed deliveries
Select replace or cancel
Generate a new Redeliver claim
Generate replacement order
Generate claim cancellation

story.description: Claim asset product should be done before a jiffy bag request is made for all claims, not only AccidentalDamageClaims. - AccidentalDamageRepairClaim - FourteenDaysReturnClaim - ReplaceAndRecoverClaim
story.name: Claim asset product before Jiffy Request

task.description: add claim asset product to AccidentalDamageRepairClaim
add claim asset product to FourteenDayReturnClaim
add claim asset product to ReplaceAndRecoverClaim

story.description: As an agent I should be required to select the correct make and model (when it can't be determined automatically) before the Jiffy bag is processed and sent to collect an AD handset
story.name: Choose claim product before sending jiffy

story.description: As a bookin operator I should not have to confirm the device and model since it was already set by the call centre before the jiffy bag was sent. Either this data is not being sent to returns, or it is not being used.
story.name: Claim Asset Product stage in screening

story.description:
As a CPP Agent I want to be able to search for a claim (by claim auth, job #, name, telephone,postcode imei or tracking ref) and see all details about a job including notes, replacement details, tracking details, etc.
I should not be able to access any other part of the system or change any data (e.g. no cancellation, no addition of notes, change address, etc)
story.name: CPP Read-only view

story.description: When recording notes the agent should be required to choose a reason from a dropdown list. List of options tbd.
story.name: Add reasons to notes

story.description: It is only possible to start bookin if you provide a claim auth number. It should be possible to supply the consignment number instead.
story.name: Cannot start bookin using consignment number

story.description: When a device is receieved back from Glasgow Express as a BER device it should be scanned into the system at http://cpp-returns.therepairline.co.uk/ber_returns. Currently this generates an error (The device IMEI was not expected as a BER return) if the original order has been shipped and completed.
story.name: Cannot scan in received BER device if replacement order has shipped

story.description: Show the failed delivery reason and the date the device was screened in VN2 in the failed deliveries queue.
story.name: Show more details on the failed delivery queue

story.description:
Current search query cannot cope with fields being nil. So e.g. an Irish claim which has a blank postcode cannot be found when searching by claim auth number.
Also want the ability to search a) By Visionnet job number b) Replacement IMEI c) Remove search by Claim Reference number
* EXACT REQUIREMENTS TO BE DEFINED WITH WALTHAM ABBEY*
story.name: Claim search improvements

story.description: On the claim summary screen I want to see the username and date/time for when a claim was created and last edited.
story.name: Display username of who uploaded claim file

story.description: Claim screen only searches the IMEI of the initially claimed device. Need it to search for a) Device received as AD (in case different from claim file) b) Shipped IMEI
story.name: Search for IMEI of shipped device

story.description: All CPP Users are setup as supervisor. Need to restrict their access levels from the admin pages
story.name: Restrict users from admin screens

story.description: As a screening operator I want to know where to route damaged devices when I fail them. Currently the instruction is to put them in a "damaged" location. The location should match the dynamics nav call which adds them to stock
story.name: Returned device screening showing incorrect routing

story.description: We want to use the Reclass API instead of the createMovement for improved perfomance.
story.name: Use reclassification journals instead of movements

story.description:
As an admin I want to be able to choose DPD as a courier for some campaigns. When the campaign setup is changed this should only affect new claims.
As a dispatcher I want to see which courier and which delivery option to use when dispatching.
As an agent I want to see what courier and which delivery option was used when a claim was dispatched.
story.name: Add DPD as a courier

story.description: As a warehouse operator I want the ability to identify a device as "not available" because of a problem picking it. The original device must be unreserved and the claim set back to no_direct_replacement to allow an alternative handset to be allocated. An email should alert the "fulfillement" team that this has occurred.
story.name: Missing device or crime related handsets

story.description: A new template has been produced for CPP2 and CPP6 collection letters. We need to replace the old templates for these letters with the new one.
story.name: Make change to CPP2 and CPP6 collection letter templates

story.description: Various fixes to attempt to improve the performance of cpp_returns. - Database indexes - Use Reclassification instead of movements - change getDetails API [Also test BER returns]
story.name: CPP Returns performance increases

story.description: There are a number of cases where a redelivery claim has been created and teh claim shows it is in replacement order. No replacement_order has actually been created (nil).
story.name: Redelivery claims not creating replacement order

story.description: As an inspection manager I want to be able to create and view reports of the inspection and screening line's performance
story.name: Expose cpp returns inspection data through pentaho

task.description: Update Couch DB with screening activities
Provide a view to download couch screening data as csv
Populate facts table in pentaho with screening data and allow ad-hoc reporting

story.description: There are occasions where the system is creating >1 replacement order with the same claim_id. This should never be possible.
story.name: Duplicate replacement orders

story.description: 1. As a user I want to be able to filter the list of displayed claims in replacement order state to focus on a particular subset. I also want to see a running subtotal of how many claims are in that state. 2. As a user I want to be able to see how many (business days) have elapsed for any claim on the replacement order screen 3. As a user processing claim asset product claims I want to be re-directed to a list of claim asset product claims as I complete each one
story.name: Improve replacement orders view

story.description:
The list of devices in the dropdown on the unprocessed_claims page is not sorted in any meaningful way. This makes it difficult to find the device you are interested in.
It is also incorrectly showing claim_asset_product claims and ingoring awaiting_stocks claims.
story.name: Improvements to unprocessed_claims page

story.description: Claim creation rules need to be updated to 1) create a ReplaceRecover claim when claim type is Accidental Damage and operator has chosen AdvanceReplacement. 2) create a Doorstep Exchange claim when claim type is Accidental Damage and operator has chosen Doorstep Exchange
story.name: Update claim creation rules for Advance replacement and Doorstep exchange (CPP7)

story.description: WIP calculation on the replacement orders screen should only start counting from when an AD/14-day device is received or a BER file uploaded. It should not use the claim upload date.
story.name: WIP Calculation for AD & BER claims

story.description:
One thing we did request if possible when we do claim asset it stays in the same screen to process the next one, but when you complete awaiting stock or failed device it goes back to ALL.
Is it possible to have the same as claim asset.
story.name: Redirect after processing

story.description:
The calls http://79.125.3.238:8888/CppProductLibraryService/products.json http://79.125.3.238:8888/CppProductLibraryService/product_families.json regularly respond very slowly. This has a big impact on the claim asset product process when devices are being identified.
Any improvments should also be deployed to Norm product liib as these calls are also made by O2UI.
story.name: Optimise product identification calls

story.description: It's been reported that some claims (e.g. 12699209 12698131) are going into claim_asset_product state after the claim_asset_product_station has been completed. As we have just identified the device this should not happen.
story.name: Transition from claim_asset_product_station to claim_asset_station

story.description: CPP4/7 branch needs to be brought up to master in order to UAT test.
story.name: Merge CPP4/7 into master

story.description: In order to make the operators aware of the reasons for a manual replacement being required for a device, display the fourteen days return reason and/or claim notes on the screen when they select a manual replacement
story.name: Show fourteen days return claim reasons and claim notes at no direct replacement screen where applicable

story.description: Certain fourteen days return claims cannot automatically replace the device automatically such as in the instances where the colour or grade of the device is incorrect. Setup a break in the flow that will send such replacements to no direct replacement available state for manual replacement.
story.name: Force manual replacement of device for fourteen days return claims based on reason for return

story.description: For some models the description being printed on the detrash station label is too long and is cutting off the memory size (E.g. 3GS). Solution is to not print the manufacturer name for apple devices.
story.name: Remove "apple" from detrash station labels

story.description: Claims raised through the warranty process do not have a cpp_claim_data model. If one of these is marked as a failed delivery it is not possible to process them in cpp claims (it is trying to extract cpp_claim data which isn't present)
story.name: Redelivery function doesn't work if no cpp_claim_data

story.description: As a scheme administrator I want the ability to have more than 1 insurance scheme (aka schema) using the same set of product alternatives.
story.name: Ability to map multiple schemes to a single alternative mapping

story.description: When a 14-day claim goes into failed delivery process and is released for re-delivery no replacement claim is created.
story.name: Cannot raise a re-delivery for a 14-day claim

story.description:
14-day claim letters should be changed to use the attached letter.
Release 21/11
story.name: Change 14-day exception letter

story.description: As a Jiffy processor I want to see 2 differnt job queues. All CPP1 Jiffy requests should be one one queue and CPP2-7 Jiffy requests should be on the other Queue.
story.name: CPP1 Jiffy Queue

story.description: If an attempt is made to screen a device which was received back as an AccidentalDamageRepair claim a clear error should be displayed to the operator telling them that this is not possible.
story.name: Attempting to screen an AccidentalDamageRepair claim device should generate an error

story.description:
A new (test) API has been provided which replaces the allocate items API used to reserve stock. It should improve performance.
Need to test that it both works and doesn't affect any other Navision APIs.
story.name: Use test Allocate Items API

story.description: In the scenario when a 2nd 14day claim is raised for a claim auth, the credit should be applied to the 1st 14day claim. Instead it is being credited to the original claim.
story.name: Original claim credited instead of subsequent 14day

story.description: There has been a security vulnerability discovered in all rails versions which necessitate upgrading to the latest release.
story.name: Upgrade rails version for CPP apps

story.description: As an agent I should not be allowed to create a 14-day claim when there is a claim with the same auth currently in progress. As an agent I should not be allowed to create a 14-day claim on an existing claim if one has previously been raised.
story.name: Restriction on creating 14-day claims

story.description: As an agent I want to be able to raise a new claim for a device retrieval, as per the (first part of the) attached flow. Data captured should be “Gadget Type” (Laptop, Handset, Gadget) Serial number (optional) Policy Number and Claim Auth Name and Address (inc postcode) Make & model of device
story.name: Raise new device retrieval claim (CPP4)

task.description: Data entry screen to capture claim details
New CPP claim type and routing

story.description: Modify Jiffy bag request. For gadgets and phones use label "CPP4" and attached letter. For laptops instruct the operator to raise a Citylink collection and capture the consignment number (no validation on consignment number)
story.name: Send collection bag (CPP4)

story.description: As a screening operator I want to scan a received consgnment number and be guided through the screening process as per the attached flow.
story.name: Device Retrieval (CPP4) screening

task.description: Add line for cpp4 devices
capture claim detail for line
confirm device details match with claim
produce initial skeleton flow for screening process from device check
add task for capturing the IMEI of a handset
add task for looking up the damaged device sku of a handset
add a task for allocating a damaged sku to laptops and gadgets
add task to assign a serial number to laptops and gadgets
create warehouse adjustment at end of screening

story.description:
Add a new dropdown to manual claim creation screen which allows the operator to choose between Standard, Advance Replacement, Doorstep Exchange when the claim type is Accidental damage.
Loss or Theft claims will always be standard.
story.name: Manual claim creation (CPP7)

story.description:
Need a new claim flow for doorstep exchanges which mimics the ReplaceRecoverClaim - go straight into device retrieval but then allow the device to be received, validated and screened.
see attached flow
story.name: Doorstep Exchange claim type (CPP7)

story.description: As a dispatch operator I want to clearly see that a dispatch is a DPD Doorstep exchange. I also want to see the work instructions (WI) attached. I also want the ability to record two tracking refs (inbound and outbound) against the claim. (Inbound is same as existing)
story.name: Modify dispatch process for CPP7

story.description: As a financial operator I want to see an item job journal to correspond with the charge job journal when credits are made. Credits should be made whenever a 14-day, warranty or failed delivery device is returned to stock.
story.name: Use ItemJobJournal for credits

story.description: Screen Accidental damage line expects all claim auths to be exactly 8 digits long. This is not correct they can be 8 to 10 (inclusive)
story.name: Screen accidental line does not accent 9 or 10 digit claim auths

story.description: As an agent I want to be able to change the name/address/tel on a claim before raising a redelivery and have it use the new address. Currently the re-delivery will always be created using the original (cpp_claim_data) address details.
story.name: Failed Delivery - redelivery using old address

story.description: When there is more than 1 claim with the same auth and the last claim is "out_for_repair". I want to be able to upload a BER report and have the claim move to replacement order.
story.name: Allow for >1 claim with same claim auth when creating BER

story.description: New claim flow is required for doorstep exchanges via DPD. Process is same as current lossTheftClaim except after sending the device it transitions to an awaiting_device state and only successful screening of the returned device transitions to complete. Use same letters as LossTheft
story.name: Doorstep exchange claim

story.description: CPPClaimData allows data to be deleted from the UI. This should not be supported, instead data should be flagged as deleted and not displayed through the UI. Additionally the user and time of deletion needs to be recorded.
story.name: Audit deletions

story.description: When screening of a returned device completes only CPP2,3,5 claims should raise a device validation status message in order to release a replacement order. Currently hydra is generating a 422 (unprocessable entity) error for Replace&Recover and AccidentalDamageRepair handsets which are screened.
story.name: Only 14-day and AD claims should raise device validation messages

story.description: As an operator I should not be able to raise a 14-day claim when there is already a claim with the same claim auth which is NOT in the completed or cancelled state.
story.name: Limit open claims to one per claim auth

story.description: In many applications there is no working functionality for a user to log out. E.g. O2 repair CPP Insurance CPP Returns
story.name: CAS logout functionality

story.description: In order to synchronise with a new video recording process we need a "pack & dispatch" station. This station will ask the operator to enter the consignment number. This is recorded and timestamped while the operator ensures a camera captures the contents of the box being put in the dispatch envelope. If necessary it will later be able to use this timestamp to retrieve the correct section of video.
story.name: Record ship/pack time

story.description: As a warehouse operator I want the ability to scan the IMEI of a device in front of me on the main pick screen without having to locate a claim. If successful, State should move to shipment, a success message is displayed and have the ability to scan the next device. If failure then display a suitable error message.
story.name: Device scan to fulfil

story.description: As a warehouse operator I want to see: - Paged view of the Picklist (20 picks per page) - A Total of number of unpicked devices - For Each Pick include, claim auth #, IMEI, Location and Accessories required
story.name: Re-design Pick list

story.description:
If a claim file has any blank lines in it, it creates blank claims that fall into the upload exception queue. See attached example.
Either need ability to delete these from the queue (dangerous!) or these need to be stripped out when parsed.
story.name: Claim File Upload Exception queue

story.description: When a device is returned under warranty for which the claim was initially raised in Sellphone the operator uses the page at http://cpp-insurance-uat.therepairline.co.uk/fourteen_days_return_claims/build_form to setup the claim. This needs to force an original_item and original_variant to be specified so that the damaged item can booked into stock on Dynamics Nav after screening
story.name: Blank item number for warranty returned devices

story.description: In every case when evaluating what devices can be used as an alternative the same rule should be applied - first look for network specific stock, then look for sim free stock. This would simplify the maintenance of the alternative matrices as the administrator can simply add one model number and the system can automatically infer the other alternative.
story.name: Alternative matrix should not be required to specify network alternatives

story.description: When specifying alternatives through the interface it is currently necessary to explicitly include every valid network specific device that can be used. Instead of this the system should follow a simple rule and automatically include first then network specific model, then the SIM Free.
story.name: Remove network options from Alternative Matrix

story.description: Some timeouts from the DNav server are causing the device reservation to fail, but the claim is proceeding to device pick. this means that it cannot find a device to pick when the operator goes into that screen
story.name: Timeout reservations are appearing in pick as "14 day good stock" bin

story.description:
Because a claim which has reached failed_device_reservation has created a device_reservation record the system will attempt to unreserve a device. In this case though the device_reference is nil (because we failed to reserve).
System needs to check for a nil device_reference and skip the unreserve call if found.
story.name: Cannot cancel a claim in failed_device_reservation

story.description: Brief Summary: When selecting the 14 day returns button to request a jiffy to be sent it will generate a Jiffy for the original Model Claimed on. If we have sent a Direct alternative or a Chosen Model when we press the 14 day returns button it will still only generate for original model unless the details are manually entered. Requirements: can we amend this so that the last model on that claim is generated not the original model ie BLACKBERRY 9000 CLAIMED ON - BLACKBERRY 9700 SENT when jiffy bag gets generated we want the blackberry 9700 to come up
story.name: 14 day claim is raised for original device, not replacement device

story.description:
The set of dispatch letters does not have a 1:1 mapping with campaigns. More than one campaign may use the same letter set.
As an admin I want the ability to manage which letter set is used on a campaign.
Letter_Matrix_2 shows which letters should be used (letter matrix) for each different letter available. Campaigns_V5 maps each campaign to the letter ID found in that matrix. Actual letters are in the zip file.
story.name: Manage campaign letters

story.description: As an operator I want the ability to change the assigned device for an order which is in the awaiting_stock state.
story.name: Provide ability to change device when no stock available

story.description: When a session in cpp-returns or cpp-insurance expires but you try to submit the page it gives a 500 error instead of taking you to the login page
story.name: Missing session expired page

story.description: As an agent I require the ability to request an additional jiffy bag is dispatched to a customer.
story.name: Raise additional Jiffy bag dispatch
Implement test-library calls to use actual sku codes on workflow-tasks gem

story.description: On succesful assignment of an alternative device the page redirects to /unprocessed_claims instead of /replacement_orders
story.name: Replacement device routing

story.description: Given an accidental damage device is at book in And a sim has been returned Then the sim should be destroyed
story.name: Accidental Damage destroy sim

task.description: Modify sim check task to record destroy task instead of package

story.description: Given a device has been returned with accessories When at book in Then the accessories are placed in a store location to be returned with new/repaired device
story.name: Accidental Damage Book in package accessories

story.description: Given a device has been booked in as accidental damage When at the start of the screening flow Then a viability check should be made on the device
story.name: Accidental Damage Device Viability

story.description: TBD
story.name: Device Retrieval (CPP4) escalation process
